entry.et: Middle English soupe, from Anglo-French supe sop, soup, of Germanic origin; akin to Old Norse soppa soup, Old English sopp sup

def.dt: :a liquid food especially with a meat, fish, or vegetable stock as a base and often containing pieces of solid food
:something (as a heavy fog or nitroglycerine) having or suggesting the consistency or nutrient qualities of soup
:an unfortunate predicament that stunt landed her in the soup

entry.et: part translation of French soupe du jour soup of the day

def.dt: :a soup that is offered by a restaurant on a particular day
:an establishment dispensing minimum dietary essentials (as soup and bread) to the needy

entry.et: soup (drug injected into a racehorse to improve its performance)

def.dt: :to increase the power or efficiency of soup up an engine
:a hodgepodge especially of initials (as of the names of organizations)
:a soup made with the nest of a swiftlet (especially Collocalia fuciphaga) that builds it using a glutinous secretion from its salivary glands
:a soup made of meat (as calf's head or veal), wine, and spices in imitation of green turtle soup
:a thick purée made of dried peas
:a mixture of organic molecules in evolutionary theory from which life on earth originated
